data.message: Can we have a Dislike option? I've come to the conclusion I would spend more time reading posts rather than less, if I could "down-vote" something, and move on. There wouldn't be any more bad feelings with it than there already are.

replies.message: Hi Terrie. We received feedback that our community would like more ways to express how they feel about Facebook posts, besides a dislike button. Reactions provide a quick and easy way to respond with a range of emotions to content your friends share. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Thanks! -Elizabeth

Facebook , I have angry-faced your reply. But, I do not feel anger. I think that the reply I received is inadequate, considering the problems that are occurring via Facebook, due to reactions and emotions through heated and abusive language all around groups and walls "on" Facebook.. A thumbs-down "button" just might offload some of that energy, and would not reduce human engagement, in my opinion. I think that most Facebook employees do not use their own employer's product, and are not having the experience most of us are. I do not expect a reply to this reply of mine, but would consider it to be decent. There is no need to "AI thank" me.
